description.narrative: The Small Holder Agribusiness Development Initiative (SADI) is a multi-sectoral program intended to achieve a sustained increase in rural growth and household incomes through productivity gains, better access to markets, and on and off-farm value-added activities. The program was supported by the Government of Indonesia, and was built on the basis of three successful, on-going activities: PNPM , the government's national poverty reduction program supported by the World Bank and other donors together with the GOI; PENSA, the IFC's Program for SME Development in Eastern Indonesia; and the Australian Center for International Agriculture Research (ACIAR)'s long-standing partnership with the Ministry of Agriculture's Agency for Agricultural Research and Development. Funding under this initiative provides administrative support to undertake a final audit of SADI. The total value of this initiative is $36,000 to be expensed during the 2010-11 financial year.
